intro: Sidalcea setosa, commonly known as the slender checker-mallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, slender stems. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Sidalcea setosa is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
